marketNews.title: Prabowo's Nephew Appointed Deputy Finance Minister
marketNews.content: President Joko Widodo officially appointed Thomas Djiwandono, the nephew of Prabowo Subianto and treasurer of the Gerindra Party, as Deputy Finance Minister on Thursday (18 July). Sufmi Dasco Ahmad, head of the Prabowo-Gibran Synchronisation Task Force, told Reuters that the appointment is intended to smooth the transition from the administration of President Jokowi to President-elect Prabowo. According to a report by Harian Kompas, Thomas began his career as a trainee reporter at Tempo magazine in 1993 and at Indonesia Business Weekly in 1994. He later worked as a financial analyst at Whetlock NatWest Securities in Hong Kong and helped his uncle, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, manage the Arsari Group as Deputy CEO. Thomas graduated from Johns Hopkins University with a degree in International Relations and International Economics. He was rumored to be considered for the next Finance Minister position after joining the Prabowo-Gibran task force on economics and finance. In comments to Reuters, Thomas said he will not become Finance Minister in the Prabowo-Gibran administration and that Prabowo is still considering professional candidates for the role. In February 2024, Bloomberg reported that Prabowo was weighing several former bankers as possible Finance Minister candidates, including the Director General of the Financial Services Authority Mahendra Siregar and the President Director of Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI) Royke Tumilaar. In April 2024, Reuters also reported that former Finance Minister Chatib Basri was among the candidates considered by Prabowo.

marketNews.title: Bloomberg Intelligence reports special monitoring board may accelerate foreign outflows
marketNews.content: Bloomberg Intelligence reported that a special monitoring board created by the Indonesia Stock Exchange could accelerate the outflow of foreign funds from the Indonesian equity market. Analyst Sufianti said that inclusion of stocks in the special monitoring board would deter foreign investors because of less transparent trading, potentially burdening broader market returns if negative reactions affect heavily weighted stocks. She noted that out of 38 stocks removed from the special monitoring board, only 16 experienced price gains.

marketNews.title: Verdhana Sekuritas economist says Prabowo-Gibran team considers cutting free lunch budget
marketNews.content: Verdhana Sekuritas economist Heriyanto Irawan said that the Prabowo-Gibran economic team is considering reducing the per-person budget for the free lunch program from 15,000 rupiah to between 7,500 and 9,000 rupiah. The statement came after his meeting with the Prabowo-Gibran team and is intended to allow the program to reach more beneficiaries. In response, Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said the free lunch program will be implemented flexibly.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia predicts current account deficit of 0.1-0.9% of GDP in 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia Governor Perry Warjiyo said the central bank forecasts Indonesia's current account deficit for 2024 to be between 0.1% and 0.9% of GDP. Previously, Indonesia recorded a current account deficit of 2.16 billion US dollars, or 0.6% of GDP, in 1Q24 (versus a surplus of 2.78 billion US dollars in 1Q23), marking the fourth consecutive quarter of deficit and the largest deficit since 2Q23.

marketNews.title: BYD launches electric multi-purpose vehicle M6 in Indonesia
marketNews.content: Chinese electric vehicle manufacturer BYD unveiled an electric multi-purpose vehicle (MPV) at GIIAS 2024 on Wednesday (17 July). The model, named M6, is offered in a 7-seater version with a range of 420-531 km and priced between 379 and 419 million rupiah. A 6-seater version is also available, priced at 429 million rupiah.

marketNews.title: Elon Musk plans to donate $45 million per month to Donald Trump's campaign
marketNews.content: The Wall Street Journal reported that Elon Musk intends to donate 45 million US dollars per month to Donald Trump's campaign committee. The journal noted that Musk indicated his plan in July 2024, although he is not yet registered as a campaign donor. Musk, who previously pledged neutrality in the U.S. election, has recently shown open support for Trump following the former president's recent assassination attempt during his campaign.

tickerNews.title: TPMA reports valuation of BEST acquisition at 3.6x P/E
tickerNews.content: $TPMA: Trans Power Marine announced that PT Bahtera Energi Samudra Tuah (BEST), recently acquired by the company, posted a net profit of 14 million US dollars in FY23 and 2.1 million US dollars in 1Q24. This implies an acquisition valuation of 3.6 times FY23 earnings, lower than our previous estimate of 3.8 times. Using annualized 1Q24 figures, the P/E rises to 6 times due to weak performance in 1Q24. TPMA told Stockbit that BEST's 1Q24 performance was affected by a force majeure event at a major clientâ€™s mine, which was resolved in 2Q24, and performance is expected to recover in the coming quarters.

tickerNews.title: ANTM reports 1H24 gold and ferronickel production and sales figures
tickerNews.content: $ANTM: Aneka Tambang reported a gold production volume of 439 kg (down 26% YoY) during 1H24, representing 45.8% of the 2024 target. Gold sales volume for 1H24 reached 15,969 kg (up 18% YoY), equal to 42.8% of the 2024 target. In the ferronickel segment, production volume was 10,169 tons (down 3% YoY) in 1H24, representing 45.3% of the 2024 target. Ferronickel sales volume for 1H24 was 6,778 tons (down 36% YoY), equal to 30.2% of the 2024 target.

tickerNews.title: ASII subsidiary Astra Finance targets 2.8 trillion IDR transactions at GIIAS 2024
tickerNews.content: $ASII: Astra Finance, a subsidiary of Astra International, aims to achieve transactions worth 2.8 trillion rupiah during the GIIAS 2024 exhibition. Director in Charge of Astra Finance, Suparno Djasmin, said the target is roughly the same as the realization at GIIAS 2023.

tickerNews.title: WIFI plans rights issue of approximately 4.7 billion new shares with up to 68.75% dilution
tickerNews.content: $WIFI: Solusi Sinergi Digital plans a rights issue of about 4.7 billion new shares, resulting in a dilution of up to 68.75%. The issue price and ratio have not been announced. Proceeds will be used to pay the principal and interest of third-party loans and for working capital. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 21 August 2024.

tickerNews.title: NCKL announces buyback plan for 630 million to 1.26 billion shares
tickerNews.content: $NCKL: Trimegah Bangun Persada announced that the total estimated number of shares to be bought back will range from 630 million to 1.26 billion shares. Previously, NCKL allocated up to 1 trillion rupiah for this corporate action, implying a buyback price of 794 to 1,587 rupiah per share. The company is still considering the optimal timing to execute the buyback.

tickerNews.title: GEMS records 1H24 coal sales and production volumes
tickerNews.content: $GEMS: Corporate Secretary of Golden Energy Mines, Sudin, reported that the company sold 25.3 million tons of coal (+25.2% YoY) during 1H24. Coal production during 1H24 reached 24.8 million tons (+21.6% YoY), representing 49.6% of the 2024 target.

tickerNews.title: KIJA to divest assets in Cikarang to cover $280 million debt
tickerNews.content: $KIJA: The President Director of Jababeka Industrial Estate (KIJA), Setyono Djuandi Darmono, said the company will divest assets such as land in Cikarang to cover corporate debt amounting to 280 million US dollars. The asset sales are intended to pay off 100 million US dollars of debt, both dollar-denominated bonds and loans from Bank Mandiri ($BMRI). The remaining 180 million US dollars of debt will be paid using a rights issue.

tickerNews.title: BBNI mentioned in Bloomberg report on potential finance minister candidates
tickerNews.content: In February 2024, Bloomberg reported that Prabowo was considering several former bankers as candidates for the Finance Minister role, including the President Director of Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI) Royke Tumilaar.
